TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 978
TEI.2.document_title: Boone Whiteside to Stephen F. Austin, 11-28-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 978

div1.p: some of the young men of this neighbourhood has obtained a quarter League of land I have never applied for any though I think myself as much Entitled to it as any Other of my age I was amongst the first in the colony and of Cours had to under go as hard times as any Other and if you think proper to let me have land I will take it on a Small Creak a Considerable distance from boath Rivers and Navasott you will Confer a favor by Writing to Col Coles and let him know whether you will Exced to my proposition or not, Boone Whiteside
